name: Over 9000 Zombies!
description: Over 9000 Zombies! is top-down arcade action blown out of all reasonable proportions. An endless horde of zombies is coming your way, how long can you survive?
minimum_requirements: Betriebssystem: Windows XP (SP3), Windows Vista (SP2), Windows 7, Windows 8 Prozessor: 2.0 GHz Dual Core Processor Arbeitsspeicher: 2 GB RAM Grafik: GeForce 8800 or equivalent. DirectX: Version 9.0c Netzwerk: Breitband-Internetverbindung Speicherplatz: 200 MB verfügbarer Speicherplatz Soundkarte: DirectX 9.0c compatible. Zusätzliche Anmerkungen: While in early access system requirements will fluctuate as development continues, please ensure you safely exceed the stated specifications to ensure the best experience.

reviews.review_text: They really sold themselves short calling this game 'over 9000' zombies.   Yeah there are over 9000 zombies. But it's like saying over 9000 grains of sand on the beach. We're talking a lot of zombies here. Like hold down the grenade button and lay on that flamethrower and there are still too many zombies to see the ground. We're talking like, if these zombies were spontaneously generating from dirt, there's no way we aren't violating conservation of mass with all these zombies. We're talking more stories than grandpa has about the fourties zombies.  It's fun and simple. Would have liked to have seen more done with the building system, would have liked to see something to help with collection of drops, would have liked to see a higher turret limit than 6 (really, only 6?), but it is what it is and it works.
This game is awesome. Great time-killer and has a variety of guns and power-ups. Get it on sale while you can. I promise you'll have no regrets getting this game. That is all.

I hate that I love this game. The graphics are meh. The shooting / targetting system is meh. The weapons are meh. Yet this game is super fun, as it is challenging, super dynamic and, well, there's tons of killing. I ike the tactical side of it, where you think how you'll use your resources to build turrets and walls to better defend yourself from the next wave of zombies. It's just pure fun. In short, worth the few dollars no doubt.

lots of simple fun with a nice weapon evolutionary system that can get you quickly addicted. The map editor is a great touch, allowing you to make and publish nice maps with a somewhat limited amount of tiles as well as download user mad maps thanks to the steam workshop. I spent an hour and was able to make what I think is an ok map 'Office Outbreak'
It certainly is 'Over 9000'!  A great game to relax with a friend or group; chill, drink, and watch the whole world burn...

For a survival game, this is an incredible purchase. Great weapon progression, challenging waves, and Steam workshop. But even after all the guns and blood, the best part is still the feature where the zombies chew through walls. Makes the map much more fun, especially on the later waves when there are hordes outside your house. Has a few bugs in 4-player split screen, but well worth your time. I would try to get it on sale though, as it can go for cheap.
